alert.note: Alert for Mesa (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 5:47PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR THE DOLORES RIVER DOWNSTREAM OF THE CONFLUENCE WITH THE SAN MIGUEL RIVER... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt and reservoir releases continues. * WHERE...Portions of the Dolores River below the confluence of the San Miguel River to the confluence with the Colorado River. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas remains possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 542 PM MDT, Gage reports indicate minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Dolores River and West Creek - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gateway. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
